To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Learn more.
   

  

 We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 7th January 2026.
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Service Delivery Manager Coop Sverige
description:
***Service Delivery Manager Coop Sverige***




  





**Ansök senast:** 
 31 januari 2026
 



**Placering:** 
 Solna
 



  





**Bli en del av Coop – Tillsammans gör vi mat-Sverige hållbart!** 




  





***Om tjänsten:***




 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens hållbara dagligvaruhandel? Som Service Delivery Manager på Coop Sverige får du möjlighet att driva innovation och bidra till vårt viktiga arbete för en mer hållbar framtid. Vi söker dig som är passionerad för IT-leveranser, kundnöjdhet och ständiga förbättringar och vill vara en del av ett dynamiskt team.
 



  





 Som Service Delivery Manager kommer du att arbeta med att:
 


* Säkerställa livscykelhantering av IT-tjänster inom Shop & Tech, inklusive planering och genomförande av utrullningar till butiker, terminaler och kontor.
* Vara spindeln i nätet mellan tjänsteägare, Service Desk och butiker vid eskaleringar och komplexa frågeställningar.Driva förbättringsåtgärder utifrån butikernas behov, ställa krav på tjänsteägare, säkra instruktioner till ServiceDesk, samt kommunicera och utbilda kund.
* Säkerställa tjänster vid nyöppningar, ändringar och stängningar av butiker.
* Ansvara för second line support för betalflöden.
* Effektivisera och optimera leveranser och processer.
* Delta i projekt för nya eller uppdaterade tjänster som utrullningsansvarig.
* Delta i avdelningens övriga arbete vid behov.



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




***Vem är du?***




 Vi söker dig som drivs av hållbarhet, kundorientering och innovation och som älskar att ta egna initiativ. Du trivs i både självständiga roller och som en del av ett team där samarbete och förändringsarbete är en del av vardagen. Du är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och har en naturlig förmåga att inspirera andra.
 



  





 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:
 



  





 Högre utbildning inom IT (systemvetare, MSc) eller motsvarande yrkeserfarenhet.
 



  





 ITIL Foundation (certifiering föredras).
 



  





 Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet, gärna från butik och/eller komplex IT-miljö.
 



  





 Erfarenhet av att styra externa leverantörer och SLA-uppföljning.
 



  





 Förmåga att prioritera, organisera och hantera flera projekt samtidigt.
 


* Erfarenhet av att bygga effektiva samarbeten genom tillit, förtroende och engagemang.
* Nytänkande och drivande med stort engagemang för att driva affären framåt och uppnå resultat.



  





 Personliga egenskaper som vi värdesätter:
 


* Engagerad och kommunikativ.
* Förmåga att ta initiativ och driva förändring.
* Flexibel och anpassningsbar till föränderliga omständigheter.
* Självgående och resultatfokuserad.
* Modig och prestigelös.



  





***Vårt erbjudande till dig***




 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i en inkluderande och inspirerande kultur. Hos oss på Coop får du vara en del av ett engagerat team och bidra till en mer hållbar framtid. Vi erbjuder även konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, flexibel arbetstid och en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.
 



  





**Så ansöker du** 




 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast 31 januari, då vi arbetar löpande med urval och intervjuer. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.
 



  





 Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Malin Hesselryd på e-postadress: malin.hesselryd@coop.se.
 



  





**Om företaget** 




**För en hållbar framtid tillsammans:** 




 Coop är Sveriges största kooperation och en ledande aktör inom dagligvaruhandeln, med över 4 miljoner medlemmar. Vi har ett stort fokus på hållbarhet och arbetar för att skapa en mer grön och rättvis framtid genom att erbjuda hållbara produkter och tjänster.
 



  





 Vi tror på att en mångfald av perspektiv och erfarenheter är nyckeln till att skapa en mer inkluderande och framgångsrik arbetsplats. Därför välkomnar vi alla oavsett kön, ålder, bakgrund och etnisk tillhörighet.
 



  





**Kontaktperson** 




 Malin Hesselryd
 



 malin.hesselryd@coop.se

title: Handläggare säkerhet
description:
Vill du vara med att både utveckla och leda säkerhetsarbetet på Skatteverket? Vi kan erbjuda dig ett utvecklande arbete där vi tillsammans skapar samhällsnytta. Just nu söker vi en säkerhetsspecialist med inriktning fysisk säkerhet som har erfarenhet av strategiskt och operativt arbete inom verksamhetsskydd och säkerhetsskydd.
   

  

 Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Du är med och utvecklar Skatteverkets säkerhetsarbete, tillsammans med dina kollegor. Ditt arbete kan bestå av utbildningsinsatser, vägledning, uppföljning, men även framtagandet av risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser samt säkerhetsskyddsanalyser. Du verkar för tillämpning av policys och riktlinjer för verksamhetsskyddet, samt säkerhetsskyddslagstiftningen och att arbetet bedrivs utifrån Skatteverkets säkerhetsstyrning.
   

  

 Du bidrar till att Skatteverket har säkerhet på rätt nivå i förhållande till de risker som finns med hänsyn till verksamhetens utveckling och omvärldens förändringar. I ditt arbete samverkar du med verksamheter inom hela Skatteverket.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
* Fysisk säkerhet (Larm och passagesystem samt kamerainstallationer/övervakning)
* Säkerhetsskydd och riskhantering
* Incidenthantering
* Risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser
* Representera sektionen i frågor som berör fysisk säkerhet
* Delta i nationella och regionala projekt inom Skatteverket
* Utbilda internt i säkerhetsfrågor
* Utbilda och skapa förståelse för Skatteverkets säkerhetsarbete på flera olika nivåer. (Stabsarbete)


 För tjänsterna gäller att man utöver ovanstående bl.a. kommer att arbeta med säkerhetsskydd och riskhantering, incidenthantering, risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra säkerhetsenheten som har runt 70 medarbetare fördelade på fem sektioner. Inom säkerhetsenhetens ansvarsområde inryms bland annat informationssäkerhet, fysisk säkerhet, krisberedskap, säkerhetsskydd, behörighetsstyrning, incidenthantering, säkerhetsrådgivning, medarbetarskydd och internutredningar. Enheten leds av Skatteverkets säkerhetschef som är tillika säkerhetsskyddschef. Din kontorsplacering är Sundbyberg och resor förekommer i tjänsten.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara prestigelös, driven och självgående och se det som en självklarhet att dela med dig av dina idéer
* vara utvecklingsinriktad och lösningsorienterad
* vara resultat- och målinriktad
* vara strukturerad, noggrann och ha hög integritet
* kunna stödja och samverka
* ha god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska
* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband och avgränsa
* ha god IT-kunskap – förstå samverkan mellan olika system.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant akademisk högskoleutbildning eller eftergymnasial utbildning inom säkerhetsområdet alternativt aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av säkerhetsarbete på myndighet eller större organisation
* minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med säkerhetsskydd och fysisk säkerhet på strategisk och operativ nivå
* kunskap om säkerhetsskyddslagen samt arbete med riktlinjer, rutiner och instruktioner inom fysisk säkerhet
* god kunskap av säkerhetsarbete med skyddsvärda byggnader samt erfarenhet av uppföljningsarbete och regelefterlevnad inom fysisk säkerhet
* erfarenhet av fysiskt säkerhetsarbete kopplat till civil beredskap
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska, då arbetet kräver att du kan författa myndighetsbeslut och skrivelser
* god datorvana, exempelvis inom Officepaketet och virtuella möten på distans
* B-körkort då resor förekommer i tjänsten.


**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/828 | Kontakt: Lars Högström, hr-specialist 010-5749156, Patrik Renman, tf sektionschef 010-5723626, | Facklig företrädare: Göran Sundwall, Saco 010-5748829, Viking Hermén, ST 010-5748013, Therese Sjödin, Seko 010-5741405, | Publicerat: 2025-12-01 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-01-07

title: IT-Projektledare till Försvarskund
description:
**Bygg framtidens IT-lösningar tillsammans med oss på Nexer Public Sales!**
 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren projektledare med gedigen bakgrund inom IT-projekt. Du kommer att leda ett eller flera projekt, ofta från start till mål. I våra uppdrag är du en nyckelperson som hjälper kunden att ta nästa steg i sin digitala utveckling.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som IT-projektledare leder du projekt kopplade till kundens systemmiljö och säkerställer att lösningarna förvaltas enligt gällande regelverk. Du arbetar med planering, koordinering och uppföljning, och bidrar till att utveckla förvaltningsprocesser för olika IT-miljöer. Arbetet varierar beroende på uppdrag och avdelning, och omfattar både vidareutveckling och vidmakthållande av befintliga lösningar. Militär erfarenhet krävs inte.
   

  

 Uppdraget är placerat hos kund i Enköping. Svenskt medborgarskap krävs och arbetet sker på plats fem dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Du har minst 9 års erfarenhet av projektledning inom IT, och har drivit både mindre och större projekt med helhetsansvar. Du är van att arbeta självständigt, samtidigt som du trivs i samarbete med team, leverantörer och kundens organisation.
   

  

 Du har:
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda projekt från initiering till slutleverans
* Vana att kommunicera med styrgrupper, ledningsgrupper och tekniska team
* Arbetat med både traditionella projektmetoder och agila arbetssätt
* Förmåga att navigera komplexa miljöer och bygga förtroende hos olika intressenter


 Relevant högskoleutbildning eller projektledarutbildning inom IT är meriterande, liksom certifieringar inom Prince2, PMI, IPMA eller motsvarande.
   

  

 Som projektledare är du engagerad, relationsskapande och målinriktad. Du har en stark förståelse för konsultrollen och ser dig själv i den långsiktigt. Du trivs med att ta ansvar, skapa struktur och driva förändring, alltid med kundens behov i fokus.
   

  

 För denna roll behöver du behärska svenska på professionell nivå i både tal och skrift
   

  

**Om Public Sales**
 Public Sales är Nexers affärsområde för offentlig sektor. Vi arbetar med samhällsviktiga uppdrag för myndigheter, regioner och kommuner, och nu stärker vi vår närvaro i Mälardalsregionen. Hos oss får du inte bara bidra till viktiga lösningar, du får också vara med och forma kulturen och bygga upp något tillsammans med oss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan via formuläret nedan. Vi hanterar inte ansökningar via e-post enligt GDPR, men har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare: Xie Gamboa, xie.gamboa@nexergroup.com
   

  

 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande så vänta inte med att söka!
   

  

 Läs mer om Nexer på www.nexergroup.com

title: Business Development Representative
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Business Development Representative to our Sales team.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Business Development Representative who wants to make a difference.
   

  

**The Team**
 The Sales team at Truesec is responsible for new businesses and managing relationships with enterprise clients and serves as the primary point of contact, ensuring client satisfaction and driving business growth through exceptional service and strategic account management.
   

  

**As a Business Development Representative you will be:**
* Respond to incoming business opportunities and inquiries.
* Initiate and drive new business acquisitions.
* Support the Sales team to develop and maintain strong relationships with major Enterprise clients, ensuring their needs are met and they are satisfied with Truesec's services.
* Serve as the main point of contact for client inquiries, concerns, and feedback, providing timely and effective solutions.
* Gain a deep understanding of clients' business objectives and cybersecurity needs.
* Identify and capitalize on opportunities
* Collaborate with the sales team to ensure the timely and successful delivery
* Monitor and report on sales performance, client satisfaction, and market trends.
* Prepare and present regular account reviews and reports to both clients and Truesec’s management.
* Handle any client issues or complaints with professionalism and efficiency.
* Stay informed about industry trends, emerging threats, and competitive landscape to provide clients with the best possible advice and solutions.
* Offered a career plan within the sales team


**Your Potential Background**
 Too succeed in this role, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have a strong interest in the cybersecurity industry.
* Have a proven success as a Sales Executive or in a similar client-facing role, ideally within the cybersecurity sector.
* Demonstrate exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, fostering strong connections with clients and stakeholders.
* Possess a proactive, results-oriented attitude and thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments.
* Excel in organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
* Have a track record of building and maintaining long-term, trusted client relationships.
* Tackles challenges with a solution-driven mindset and remains composed under pressure.
* Are proficient in CRM tools (preferably Hubspot) and skilled in using the Microsoft Office Suite.
* Exhibit business-level fluency in reading, writing, and speaking both Swedish and English.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Commercial Data Scientist, AI / Digital Transformation - Stockholm
description:
As a Data Scientist, you’ll be at the heart of Arla’s digital transformation—turning data and AI into tangible commercial impact. You’ll partner closely with Net Revenue Management, Customer Development, Finance, and cross-functional teams across Retail and Foodservice to solve high-value problems and drive change on some of Arla’s most strategic projects.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
* Design, build, and deploy advanced analytics and AI solutions that directly address strategic business needs (with focus on our strategic agenda) through combining external market data with internal Arla data.
* Partner across Net Revenue Management, Customer Development, Finance, and other functions to identify, prioritize, and deliver high-impact data opportunities.
* Translate complex business challenges into clear analytical approaches, ensuring insights drive measurable outcomes.
* Lead and execute digital transformation initiatives that scale across markets and functions.
* Communicate insights clearly and drive adoption among diverse stakeholders; enable change management.
* Define and track impact with robust measurement frameworks.
* Stay ahead of data science and AI trends and introduce innovative, practical methods.
* Collaborate with IT and data engineering to ensure robust, secure, and scalable data foundations.
* Act as a subject matter expert and ambassador for data-driven decisions across Arla.


**What Will Make You Successful**
* Masters in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field.
* 5+ years in data science/analytics (FMCG or similar is a plus).
* Proven delivery of AI/ML solutions that drive business transformation.
* Strong business acumen; able to plan, prioritize, and translate needs into technical solutions.
* Track record managing complex, multi-stakeholder projects.
* Skilled in Python, R, SQL, and visualization (Power BI, Tableau).
* Excellent communicator, able to simplify complex topics for non-technical audiences.
* Experience with Net Revenue Management, Customer Development, and Finance is highly desirable.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


**Personal Attributes**
* Strategic thinker passionate about digital innovation and transformation.
* Influential communicator and natural collaborator.
* Clear commercial mindset and curiosity for the customer and market.
* Action-oriented, focused on turning insights into outcomes.


**What do we offer?**
 Join our Customer Development team within Retail Sales as a Data Scientist—an environment defined by ambition, data-driven decision-making, and a strong portfolio of respected brands. In this cross-functional role, you’ll collaborate closely with sales, marketing, and category teams to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive customer strategies and commercial outcomes. You’ll benefit from continuous professional development, modern analytics tools, and the opportunity to grow your career while working alongside talented colleagues dedicated to delivering exceptional results.
   

  

**About Arla Foods**
 Arla Foods is an international farmer-owned cooperative and Scandinavia’s largest dairy producer. We’re among the world’s leaders by milk intake and the largest producer of organic dairy globally. Our 2026 strategy focuses on sustainability, scaling our strongholds, and leveraging the Arla brand across the Eurozone—where innovation and data-driven decisions are key drivers of growth and impact.
   

  

**Would you like to join us?**
 Please apply as soon as possible and no later than 18th of November. For information about the process, please contact Mikael Augustinson miaug@arlafoods.com.
   

  

***Shape the Future of Dairy***
*Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to producing high-quality products while championing sustainability and innovation. We're passionate about people and our planet, striving to unleash the full potential in each of us. Our goal is to make healthy dairy nutrition and good food habits accessible to all. Join us at Arla Foods and become part of a worldwide cooperative dedicated to making a significant impact on the planet and steering the dairy industry towards a sustainable future.*
*We are devoted to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity and collaboration are key to our success, propelling us to new heights in the dairy industry.*
 Ref. 104405

title: Manager Specialty Engineering
description:
MilDef, en global ledare inom ruggade IT-lösningar, expanderar sitt team i Stockholm (Rosersberg) och söker nu en engagerad ledare för vårt Specialty Engineering team och som som vill vara med och forma framtidens försvarssystem.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö, där det händer mycket och där din roll kommer att utvecklas över tid.
   

  

**Din nya utmaning**
 Som
 **Manager Specialty Engineering** 
 på MilDef får du en nyckelroll i att leda och utveckla vår Specialty Engineering-funktion. Du ansvarar för att säkerställa en effektiv tillämpning av Integrated Logistics Support (ILS), Technical Documentation, System Safety och Cyber Security i våra projekt. Rollen innebär både strategiskt och operativt ansvar, där du skapar struktur, metodik och förutsättningar för hög kvalitet i våra leveranser.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära projekt, produktutveckling och andra ingenjörsfunktioner för att säkerställa säkra, driftsäkra och väl dokumenterade systemlösningar. Med fokus på kompetensutveckling, samverkan och ständiga förbättringar bidrar du till att stärka MilDefs tekniska förmåga och långsiktiga konkurrenskraft.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda och utveckla Specialty Engineering-teamet med ansvar för kompetens, kapacitet och framtida behov
* Etablera, förvalta och vidareutveckla processer och arbetssätt inom ILS, teknisk dokumentation, systemsäkerhet och IT-säkerhet
* Säkerställa att teamet efterlever relevanta standarder, regelverk och kundkrav
* Samordna specialty engineering-aktiviteter i projekt för att möjliggöra säkra och kvalitativa leveranser
* Driva metod- och arbetssättsutveckling för ökad kvalitet, effektivitet och enhetlighet
* Arbeta tvärfunktionellt för att integrera specialty engineering i projektgenomförande och produktutveckling
* Bidra till MilDefs övergripande affär och tekniska utveckling genom ett aktivt och närvarande ledarskap


**Det här bidrar du med**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av metod- och processutveckling inom ILS, teknisk dokumentation eller systemsäkerhet
* God förståelse för supportability-, tillförlitlighets- och säkerhetsprinciper i tekniska system
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med standarder, regulatoriska krav och kundkrav i komplexa miljöer
* Dokumenterad ledarskapsförmåga
* Relevant ingenjörsutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet


 Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Du talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska samt har körkort för bil, då resor i tjänsten kan förekomma.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag i en expansiv bransch.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal (Teknikföretagen).
* Wellnessteam och friskvårdsbidrag.
* Eget Gym med bastu.
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar.
* Happiness teamet ordnar med roliga och personalvårdande aktiviteter.
* Arbete i helt nybyggda ändamålsenliga lokaler vid Rosersbergs pendeltågsstation.


**Lär känna oss**
 Om du är en motiverad och driven ledare som söker en spännande möjlighet att växa och göra skillnad, vill vi gärna höra från dig.
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på MilDef.com. För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Viktor Attoff, Head of Projects and Solutions, på viktor.attoff@mildef.com
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande urval och därför vill vi gärna få in din skriftliga ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast 2026-01-18..
   

  

**Viktig information**
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller och drogtest på alla våra blivande kollegor innan anställning.
   

  

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***
*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for military, government and critical infrastructure sectors. MilDef provides hardware, software, and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest. MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia, and through partner networks in more than 40 countries. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*
**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales!**

title: Stödassistent på gruppbostad, Huddinge kommun
description:
Välkommen till Huddinge kommun och Huddingefamiljen!
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att göra skillnad varje dag.
   

  

 Som medarbetare i Huddinge kommun är du en del av en organisation som värdesätter utveckling, samarbete och kvalitet.
   

  

 Du får chansen att påverka och utveckla verksamheten, samtidigt som vi erbjuder attraktiva förmåner och en trygg arbetsmiljö. Att arbeta i Huddinge innebär att du blir en del av ett engagerat team som arbetar för att skapa ett gott liv för alla våra invånare.
   

  

**Om tjänsten och arbetsuppgifter:**
 Du kommer att vara en viktig del i att skapa en trygg, utvecklande och meningsfull tillvaro för omsorgstagarna. Samarbete med övrigs professioner ingår i din roll för att säkerställa att behov tillgodoses på ett pedagogiskt och strukturerat sätt. Fokus ligger på individens delaktighet och självbestämmande. Utifrån lagar, mål och riktlinjer bidrar du till att brukaren står i centrum och har inflytande över samt är delaktig i sina insatser.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta utifrån LSS och annan relevant lagstiftning samt kommunens värdegrund och mål. Insatserna ska utgå från individens psykiska, fysiska och sociala behov.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Arbetet innebär att ge individuellt anpassat stöd i en trygg och stimulerande miljö utifrån varje persons enskilda behov.
* Stöd vid kontakter med daglig verksamhet, familj, vänner samt att uppmuntra till och stödja fritidsaktiviteter.
* I arbetet ingår omsorg, ADL, sjukvårdande arbetsuppgifter på delegation från sjuksköterska och annan legitimerad personal.
* Planera och genomföra aktiviteter utifrån brukares behov och önskemål.


 Även dokumentation samt uppgifter tillhörande hemmet tillkommer såsom stöttning vis städ, tvätt, inköp och matlagning. Tjänstgöring: dag/ kväll/ helg.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer:**
* Utbildning som stödassistent (undersköterska med inriktning mot funktionshinderområdet/ äldreomsorg) eller annan utbildning som bedöms som likvärdig.
* God svenska i tal och skrift.
* Grundläggande IT- kunskaper för dokumentation.
* Kunskap om LSS samt relevanta lagar.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med lågaffektivt bemötande.


**Arbetsrollen:**
 Vi söker dig som är pedagogisk, strukturerad och trygg i ditt arbetssätt. Du skapar förtroendefulla relationer, kommunicerar tydligt och bemöter brukare med empati och professionalism. Du har god förståelse för funktionsnedsättningar och arbetar individanpassat med stöd av tydliggörande pedagogik och lågaffektivt bemötande. Du är självständig och lösningsorienterad, men också en lagspelare som kan handleda kollegor och bidra till verksamhetens utveckling.
   

  

 Dokumentation och kvalitetssäkring är naturliga delar av ditt arbetssätt. Stor vikt kommer att läggas på personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Varför Huddinge?**
 För att vi ska kunna utföra vårt uppdrag är du som medarbetare i Huddinge kommun det viktigaste vi har. Därför erbjuder vi en rad förmåner för ett hållbart arbetsliv och för att underlätta din vardag: Arbeta i Huddinge kommun
   

  

**Upplysningar:**
**Lön enligt avtal.**
 Vid frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta tillförordnad biträdande enhetschef Zakia Rakez: Zakia.Rakez@huddinge.se
   

  

 Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonsering och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.
   

  

 För att underlätta rekryteringsarbetet ber vi dig att bifoga relevanta intyg och betyg för tjänsten du söker samt vid eventuell intervju ha möjlighet att uppvisa giltig ID- handling såsom pass eller nationellt ID- kort.
   

  

 För att vi ska kunna hantera alla ansökningar på bästa sätt ber vi dig att söka direkt via våra utannonserade tjänster. Vi tar inte emot spontana ansökningar via e-post. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen.
   

  

 För denna tjänst behöver du kunna uppvisa ett giltigt utdrag ur belastningsregistret innan anställning kan påbörjas.
   

  

 Välkommen in med din ansökan!
   

  

**Om arbetsplatsen** 
 I Huddinge kommun arbetar vi för att skapa ett hållbart samhälle, där natur, teknik och god service samspelar. Huddinge är en stor Stockholmskommun med cirka 6 400 medarbetare och fler än 110 000 invånare. Hos oss känner du dig trygg, delaktig och stolt när vi med kraft gör skillnad, varje dag.
 **Facklig kontaktperson**
 För facklig kontaktperson för tjänsten se Facklig kontaktinformation
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök senast: 2025-12-22
   

  

 Referensnummer: C293809
   

  

**Anställning**
 Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen: 2
   

  

*Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonsering och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.*

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Som lösningsarkitekt hos oss blir du en nyckelperson som omsätter verksamhetsbehov till smarta och hållbara IT-lösningar. Du arbetar nära kunder och team, leder designarbetet och säkerställer att lösningarna är tekniskt robusta och framtidssäkra. Rollen ger dig möjlighet att påverka strategiska beslut, driva innovation och skapa värde i komplexa projekt, alltid med stöd av ett starkt nätverk av experter.
   

  

**DIN PROFIL**
* Flera års erfarenhet som end-to-end lösningsarkitekt, med bred teknisk kompetens och förståelse för systemutveckling.
* Förmåga att omsätta verksamhetskrav till hållbara arkitekturlösningar, med helhetsperspektiv och fokus på processer och informationsflöden.
* Intresse och erfarenhet av moderna teknologier såsom molnlösningar, AI, säkerhet och automatisering.
* Van att leda och samarbeta i komplexa projekt, med kunskap om etablerade ramverk för arkitektur och agil utveckling.
* Högskoleutbildning inom IT/Systemvetenskap, samt goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**VAD VI TROR KOMMER ATT FÅ DIG ATT TRIVAS**
* En positiv arbetsmiljö med fokus på innovation och kompetensutveckling.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med de senaste tekniktrenderna och inspirerande kollegor.
* Tillgång till globalt och lokalt arkitektforum för kunskapsutbyte och utveckling.
* En kultur som bygger på samarbete, lärande och våra värderingar: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun.


**ANSÖKAN**
* Vi arbetar med löpande urval så vänta inte - skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Vi ser framemot din ansökan och att du vill bli en del av vår fortsatta resa!
* Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.


**OM CAPGEMINI**
 Capgemini är en AI-driven global partner för affärs- och tekniktransformation som levererar konkret verksamhetsnytta. Vi formar framtiden för organisationer och förverkligar den med hjälp av AI, teknik och människor. Med vår starka historia på nästan 60 år är vi en ansvarsfull och mångsidig koncern med 420 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Genom vår expertis inom strategi, teknik, design, ingenjörstjänster och affärsverksamhet levererar vi heltäckande tjänster och lösningar, baserade på vår djupa branschkunskap och vårt omfattande partnernätverk. Koncernen rapporterade globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro för 2024.
   

  

**Make it real** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Detection Engineer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Detection Engineer to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Managed Security Service domain.**
**About Truesec – Safeguarding Society In a Digital World**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Detection Engineer who wants to make a difference in our Managed Security Service domain.
   

  

**Managed Security Services**
 Truesec helps customers globally with Managed Detection & Response including Attack Prediction Services, Vulnerability Management Services for both IT and OT environment. Our services are all delivered by skilled security analysis teams that conduct 24/7 attack monitoring, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, and threat remediation. Our team of experts works tirelessly to identify and prevent cyber breaches, and to help increase our customers’ proactive cybersecurity defenses. Our goal is to be an extension of our customers’ IT organizations, customizing a combination of capabilities and tooling, tailored to prevent cyber attacks in the most efficient way.
   

  

**The Role**
 This position is a vital role for the continued development of our detection capabilities, enabling the SOC to find more advanced threat actors by leveraging automation, enrichment and cross platform correlations to create high level alerting on top of various security platforms as well as automated handling of low level alerts in order for the analysts to focus on more critical incidents. You will be part of the Detection Engineering team, but also spend a lot of your time in cross-domain teams, working close to operations and developers to create solutions fitting a wide variety of use cases.
   

  

 In this role you will:
   

  

* Create automations within SOAR platforms to enrich alerts and entities from various security platforms.
* Monitor for use cases where automation can automatically handle alerts by analyzing large amounts of alert metadata.
* Enable and educate SOC analysts by sharing expertise in detection engineering, development and threat hunting.
* Support and mentor SOC analysts during escalations, acting as second line of defense in complex investigations or during threat hunts.
* Collaborate closely with SOC Management in order to reduce the workload on the analysts through automation.
* Collaborate with development teams in order to create, integrate and maintain solutions through API.
* Create visualizations of alerts and entities within the SOAR platform.
* Create enrichment queries for a variety of security platforms, such as Crowdstrike, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and SentinelOne.
* Track and report on the effectiveness of automations.


 This role is key for the SOCs continued development, creating higher fidelity alerts and reducing the amount of noise.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
* Passion for cybersecurity and leveraging technology to solve complex challenges and improve SOC efficiency, with 2–5 years of hands-on experience in cybersecurity, ideally within a SOC or similar environment.
* Proven track record of developing and implementing automation or enrichment solutions in a SOC context, with experience in security automation, detection engineering, and security operations.
* Hands-on experience with SIEM and SOAR platforms and familiarity with major security platforms such as Crowdstrike, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, and SentinelOne.
* Proficiency in scripting, automation, and query languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, KQL, Elastic) to build, tune, and maintain detections, automations, and enrichment workflows.
* Strong understanding of security alerting, enrichment, and detection workflows across EDR, SIEM, XDR, and NDR platforms, including analyzing large alert metadata datasets to improve detection fidelity and reduce noise.
* Ability to work in agile, cross-domain teams with SOC analysts, operations, developers, and stakeholders, with strong communication, documentation, visualization, and reporting skills, and exposure to threat hunting, incident response, and security analysis.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Senior Security Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Senior Security Infrastructure Engineer to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Secure Infrastructure domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Senior Security Infrastructure Engineer who wants to create advanced security solutions in our Secure Infrastructure Domain.
   

  

**Secure Infrastructure**
 Looking at the actual threat landscape today, it’s more important than ever to design and build infrastructure solutions that incorporate correct and relevant security features. The team works closely together using their combined knowledge and experience gathered from different projects and Incident Response cases to help our customers stay ahead of the threat actors. We continuously help customers improve their security posture within cloud, data center, endpoint management, identity, M365, and networking.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Security engineer interfaces regularly with team members and customers, determine technical requirements, feasibility of projects and expectations. You are responsible for maintaining, implementing, and designing client-facing solutions primarily in Active Directory, Entra ID, Azure and Microsoft 365 Security Solutions. This role is for someone who wants to be hands-on in a Microsoft infrastructure role leaning towards cloud but with the experience and knowledge of On-premises/hybrid environments. You must be able to think on your feet and you’ve got to want to learn and be part of a highly skilled and innovative team.
   

  

 Other responsibilities you might have can be:
   

  

* Run health and security checks on Active Directory, Microsoft 365 including Entra ID.
* Assisting our Customers with Tiering Projects.
* Provide customers with design and also assist with the actual implementation.
* Implement solutions based on Statement of Work with customers.


**Your Potential Background**
 We believe that your background probably entails 7+ years of experience and expertise within Microsoft solutions for both Cloud and On-premise/hybrid environments. You feel comfortable with guiding stakeholders towards a more secure and robust environment by giving technical recommendations that can persist the current threats present today.
   

  

 You are comfortable with guiding customers within areas such as: AD-Security, Entra ID-security, Windows Server Hardening, Azure security.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Active Directory Security
* Windows server Security
* Azure Security
* Microsoft 365 Security
* Overall a strong Cybersecurity competence within Microsoft Infrastructure.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell and/or Python
* Cloud migration journeys from On-prem to Azure.
* Experience with Azure networking: Express Route, Virtual Network & Load Balancers
* Hypervisor knowledge of Hyper-V, VMware.
* Experience working with monitoring and logging tools (e.g.: Log Analytics, Azure Monitor, Azure Sentinel, ELK/ElasticSearch/Kibana)
* Experience with other cloud providers such as AWS and GCP.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Sr. Real Time Media Engineer
description:
Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.
   

  

 Meet the Team
   

  

 Cisco is starting up a new engineering site in Stockholm, focused on WebEx in general and the meeting experience in particular.
   

  

 Cisco WebEx helps people and businesses across the entire world to connect and collaborate. As a member of the WebEx media team, your work will ensure that every person using our products will get truly immersive experience regardless of device or location.
   

  

 First and foremost, you will be working with us. We are a team of highly motivated professionals, and we sincerely believe that this will be the working experience of a lifetime for you. We offer you outstanding professional software product development experience in a friendly atmosphere of a startup-like team culture.
   

  

 WebEx is powering the shift to the hybrid workforce! People spend more time using our digital collaboration tools, and we want to make sure that they feel truly connected! We hire great people who are eager to contribute to our culture, and we empower them to do just that. We take pride in thinking beyond our day-to-day job descriptions and encourage you to actively seek opportunities to build the type of work environment that you want to be a part of.
   

  

 Your Impact
   

  

 You are the kind of engineer that loves media in any way shape or form. The harder the challenge the more fun you think it is and you are comfortable rolling your sleeves up. You are friendly, creative and independent, as well as enthusiastic about learning new technologies and passionate about programming and software development.
   

  

 You enjoy mentoring more junior colleagues and pushing the boundaries of today’s technologies. You have been working within the real-time media space for a while, probably have some great ideas of things to improve, and now want to take the next step.
   

  

**More Specifically, On a Day-to-day Basis This Role Involves**
* leading new initiatives to improve the in-meeting experience of WebEx meetings
* bringing to life new software functionality based on product requirements
* participating in agile ceremonies (daily stand-ups, planning, release and retrospective meetings)
* broadening your technical and soft skills with the help of our training programs


**Minimum Qualifications**
* You must have verbal and written skills in English and a master’s degree in software engineering or another relevant natural sciences field and 10+ years of relevant experience.
* A good handle of C/C++ programming language
* A solid understanding of design patterns, data structures and algorithms
* Working experience with media streaming and relevant protocols
* An experience with incremental development, testing, and A/B testing in production.
* Hands on experience with building close to real-time applications.


 Deep understanding of at least one of the following areas:
   

  

* Network resiliency for real-time media
* Audio or video encoding/decoding technologies


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Cloud technologies (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud)


 Why Cisco?
   

  

 At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.
   

  

 Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.
   

  

 We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

title: Principal AI Consultant
description:
**Join us!**
 We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Principal AI Consultant at Futurice you will be the bridge between bold business ambitions and technical execution. Think of this role as the “Product Manager” for high-impact client engagements: you hold the vision, rally the team, and ensure we aren’t just building cool tech, but delivering real business value.
   

  

 You will lead multidisciplinary project teams—guiding Senior AI Engineers, Designers, and Data experts—to transform organizations. You understand the language of business and the nuances of AI; you know when a project requires a complex RAG architecture and when simple prompt engineering is the smarter, faster choice.
   

  

 You will wear many hats: a strategist who frames the problem, a delivery lead who gets things done, and a trusted advisor who helps clients navigate the cultural shifts required to adopt AI.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead AI Engagements: Take ownership of complex AI projects from kick-off to deployment, leading a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, and strategists.
* Bridge Business & Tech: Translate client business goals into technical requirements and vice versa. Steer technical decisions to prioritize speed-to-value.
* Drive Transformation: Go beyond the build by helping clients operationalize AI, advising on governance, ethics, organizational change, and process redesign.
* Co-create Winning Proposals: Support the sales process by consulting during the proposal phase—scoping opportunities, defining value propositions, and structuring roadmaps.
* Implement a Product Management Mindset: Manage the backlog and roadmap of projects, making prioritization decisions to focus on the highest-value activities.
* Lead by Example: Demonstrate high AI fluency by leveraging AI tools in your own work and demoing concepts and workflows.
* Stakeholder Management: Build strong relationships with client stakeholders, managing expectations and fostering collaboration.


**Who We’re Looking For**
* The “get it done” attitude
* Strong background in digital consulting, product management, or technical project management
* Strong AI & tech literacy, including LLMs, agents, RAG, and cloud ecosystems
* Strategic pragmatism and ability to separate hype from value
* Experience guiding digital or cultural transformation
* Fluent Swedish and English
* Strong facilitation skills for workshops, sprints, and steering meetings


**Ideally, you also have**
* Experience acting as a Product Owner or Product Manager in an Agile environment
* A portfolio of side projects or workflows using Generative AI
* Experience in change management or organizational design


**Futurice offers you**
 At Futurice, we support your growth as a professional and as a person. You’ll work on a diverse portfolio of projects with motivated, multi-talented colleagues across technology, design, and strategy.
   

  

**In Addition, We Offer**
* A hybrid work model
* Free choice of work equipment (laptop, phone, accessories)
* Sports and lunch benefits
* Futurice clubs and community activities
* Learning events and certification programs


**Compensation**
 Your compensation package will be discussed during the recruitment process. Our salary model is based on skills, responsibilities, and impact, with a fixed salary and the possibility of performance-based bonuses.
   

  

**Next steps**
 If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for, we’d love to hear from you. Our application process is simple: submit your contact details, CV, and a few lines about yourself and why you want to join Futurice. You’re also welcome to share links to LinkedIn or a portfolio.
   

  

 Our recruitment process typically includes an initial conversation, an in-depth discussion with future colleagues, and a final general chat. Reference checks are a natural part of the process.
   

  

**What It’s Like To Work Here**
 Ever since Futurice was founded, we’ve focused on creating a workplace people genuinely enjoy, Mondays included. As a community, we’ve built and continue to shape a healthy, welcoming culture where you’re met with trust and kindness, and where your well-being is valued every bit as much as the great work you do. The atmosphere is open, warm, and buzzing with ideas and good conversations. You’ll quickly make friends, and grabbing a coffee or spending time together after work happens naturally.
   

  

 And because our culture is shaped by all of us, every day, you’ll have the freedom to influence how we work, connect, and evolve as a community. Each of our offices also brings its own character to the mix.
   

  

 At Futurice, new joiners aren’t expected to fit into a mold. Come as you are, whatever your background. We believe in the power of different perspectives, and diversity is a key part of our success. You can read more about our DE&I commitment here.
   

  

 We help organizations unlock new value by combining data, AI, design, and strategy. Our promise is simple: faster, smarter delivery; AI-powered decisions; and exceptional, data-driven experiences. We deliver clarity, and clarity delivers results.
   

  

 Our vision is to redefine organizations with data and AI. Large enterprises work with us to build smarter services, accelerate decision-making, and strengthen their competitive edge.
   

  

 Founded in 2000, Futurice has grown into an 800+ person community across Europe. Our culture is built on trust, transparency, care, and continuous improvement. We offer a collaborative, international environment where ambitious people learn, grow, and make a real impact.

title: Gameplay Programmer
description:
**About Star Stable Entertainment** 




 Once upon a time in 2011, the founders of Star Stable Entertainment had a vision. They wanted to create a game that could make a difference. Although half of gamers are girls and women, they were under-represented in the gaming industry, both as characters and creators. We dreamed of an epic online world where tween and teen girls could share an amazing experience. And we wanted to challenge how things were done in a male-dominated industry. Fast forward to today, and our dream has come true tenfold - Star Stable Online stands as one of the most popular MMORPGs globally! At our HQ on Södermalm, our 140 employees are thrilled to continue to welcome players to the island of Jorvik, with its breathtaking scenery, beautiful horses, and magical quests. It’s wonderful to see that our dream resonates with so many players around the world, and we can’t wait to share more stories and experiences with them!
 



  





**The position** 




 As a Gameplay Programmer, you exist at the intersection between code and content, with one foot in either world. On one side, you’re building a modern and future-proof technical platform while on the other, you are writing feature specific code to bring the combined creativity of code and content to life as exciting gameplay features.
 



 Are you interested in working on diverse tasks ranging from under the hood data processing to making the player camera feel smooth? Do you like working closely with creative designers and artists as well as other programmers and technical QA?
 



  





 Then we have an opportunity for you as we are currently looking to strengthen our team with another Gameplay programmer!
 



  





**As a Gameplay Programmer, you will:** 



* Design, maintain, develop and test player facing gameplay systems and internal tools.
* Drive the planning and execution of projects to deliver technical solutions for a wide variety of game features.
* Support the creative disciplines in joint projects to develop exciting new gameplay features.
* Take part in knowledge sharing and support the growth and development of your fellow colleagues.
* Ensure smooth development via efficient communication with other technical disciplines such as Engine, Server and Tools.
* Work closely with QA to squash bugs and ensure smooth releases.
* Facilitate communication between the technical disciplines and content developers as well as producers.



  





**We think you** 



* Have 3+ years of experience in the gaming industry.
* Have a good understanding of C++ and tools commonly used in the games industry.
* Care about the player experience and have the ability to view the game through the player’s eyes.
* Are a strong communicator with the ability to break down complex topics for technical and non-technical colleagues alike.
* Enjoy mentorship and making the people around you shine.
* Are organized and like to keep a holistic view of your project and feel comfortable driving cooperation with other disciplines.
* Enjoy supporting colleagues both inside and outside of the programming discipline.
* Have a good understanding of memory and CPU profiling.
* Are used to working with version control systems (We use Perforce).
* Have experience working with proprietary game engines and editors.



  





**Perks for joining us?** 



* A pretty sweet mission. We are developing the world's best horse-riding game for girls and we take that vision very seriously. We strive to hit that mark every single day.
* 30 vacation days (+ 3 additional squeeze days).
* A pension and insurance plan that mimics ITP1 and a parental pay top-up @90%.
* Health allowance at 5000 SEK per year.
* Hybrid working model - combine WFH and being together with the team at our new office located right amidst Södermalm GameDev cluster (Magnus Ladulåsgatan 65)
* Fitness discount of 18% at SATS gym + company workout classes.
* A dog room at the office! Bring your furry friend to work!



  





 Are you ready to be a chapter on this magical journey? Apply now! We can’t wait to hear your story!

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Here at Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That's why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We’re looking for a talented Senior Software Developer to join our Stockholm team in a hybrid role and help us shape the future of billing!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We’re looking for a Senior Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a great platform to prove that great business grows from great relationships. This is a flexible hybrid role based in Stockholm, with no relocation assistance offered.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Standardize & Scale** 
 : Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* **Tackle Tech Debt** 
 : Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* **Create Real Value** 
 : Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients and their customers will love.
* **Lead & Collaborate** 
 : Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas, guide technical decisions, and keep our platform moving forward.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 We want someone humble, hungry, and happy: eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
 



  





**Key Qualifications** 



* **Language Expertise** 
 : At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP or Python (ideally both, but strong in one with openness to learn the other works too), ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* **Adaptability** 
 : An openness to learning new tools in our stack (think AWS, databases, and more).
* **Product Mindset** 
 : Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.
* **Problem-Solver** 
 : A knack for breaking down complex challenges into clean, maintainable solutions.



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* **B2B & B2C Background** 
 : Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* **Scaling Know-How** 
 : Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.
* **Payments Experience** 
 : A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.



  





**Why Work with Us?** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





 This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.
 



  





 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Network and Client Management – UK
description:
**Are you a relationship builder with a passion for driving growth?**
 Do you thrive in conversations with senior decision-makers and know how to turn them into lasting partnerships?
   

  

 Are you motivated by achieving tangible results while expanding a powerful international business network?
   

  

 If that sounds like you, keep reading.
   

  

**Your Misison**
 Management Events is seeking
 **Key Client Managers and Network Growth Managers** 
 to join our team. You will play a pivotal role in expanding our network of high-level decision-makers. How do these roles contribute to the company's growth?
   

  

 As a
 **Key Client Manager** 
 , you will focus on building and maintaining strong relationships with existing C-suite clients.
   

  

 As a
 **Network Growth Manager** 
 , you will identify and cultivate new relationships with C-suite executives.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Identify and engage with high-level decision-makers in your target market market.
* Initiate contact with C-level Executives by phone and on LinkedIn to excite them about our concept.
* Demonstrate the value of our service and convince them to become part of our exclusive business network in personal scheduled videocall meetings.
* Build strong, long-term relationships with C-level executives.
* Learn more about their interests, investments plans and upcoming projects.
* Develop and execute strategies to expand our network and build valuable relationships, by knowing your customers key challenges and focus areas.
* Contribute to the overall growth and success of Management Events.


****What We’re Looking For****
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong business acumen and a results-oriented mindset.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.
* Have a passion for connecting with key industry players and driving business growth.
* Proactive approach and eagerness towards connecting with new clients and overcoming challenges.
* Ideally experience in a commercial and/or client-facing role (e.g. hospitality, sales, customer service, etc.).
* Fluency in English.


**What We Offer**
* Performance rewarded: You’ll receive an attractive compensation package with base salary, commission, and an additional starter bonus to support you as you ramp up and build your sales pipeline.
* Growth and learning: From day one, you’ll benefit from a four-week onboarding program and continuous coaching through our international ME Academy, ensuring you’re always developing and moving forward in your career.
* Career opportunities across Europe: As we continue to grow, you’ll have the chance to explore international opportunities. With offices in Helsinki, Amsterdam, Antwerp, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, Kuala Lumpur, and Barcelona, your career can take you anywhere.
* Recharge & Thrive: We care about your well-being and want you to stay energized both inside and outside of work. That’s why you can earn up to 12 extra vacation days each year and enjoy local perks such as gym and massage discounts, along with other wellness benefits. Curious about the details in your location? Ask your recruiter to learn more.
* We win together: Collaboration is our driving force, and every success is shared. That’s why we love bringing people together through company trips, international events, and local office celebrations — whether it’s hitting the slopes in Levi, running the Berlin Marathon together, or celebrating milestones across our offices in Europe.
* Annual company trip: Every summer, all employees from our different offices come together in Finland for an exciting company trip — a mix of team building, knowledge exchange, and celebrations.
* Global Community & Diversity: Diversity is part of our DNA. With colleagues from over 50 nationalities, you’ll join an international community where every culture, perspective, and background fuels innovation and success.


**Recruitment Process**
* Screening video call with our Recruitment Team
* First interview with the Hiring Manager
* Second interview with a team member
* Reference check and/or short personal assessment


 Please submit your
 **CV in English**
**About Management Events**
 Aurora Live by Management Events is the
 **leading B2B partner** 
 for technology and management service providers — connecting them directly with top decision-makers from the largest and most influential companies.
   

  

 Through our
 **exclusive matchmaking platform** 
 , we help commercial teams
 **shorten sales cycles, accelerate business conversations, and build lasting customer relationships** 
 .
   

  

 Trusted by
 **over 10,000 senior IT decision-makers** 
 and
 **900 solution providers** 
 across 11 countries, we create
 **strategic meetings that deliver** 
 real business results.
   

  

 We’re proud to be the trusted partner of some of the most
 **innovative companies in the technology and management space** 
 .
   

  

 At
 **Aurora Live by** 
**Management Events** 
 , we’re transforming the way leaders connect, collaborate, and grow.
   

  

 Working with us means being part of an
 **international, fast-paced, and purpose-driven company** 
 , where ambition meets action and every idea can make an impact.
   

  

 Our teams bring together smart, curious, and driven individuals who love what they do — connecting visionary leaders, shaping industries, and celebrating success along the way.
   

  

**Ready to be part of something extraordinary?** 
 Join us and help shape the future of business connections.

title: Business Controller
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally and world's #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**As a Business Controller,** 
 you will be an essential part of our finance team. Your main responsibility will be to provide accurate financial analysis in order to make informed decisions and drive our success. To excel in your role, it is crucial that you go beyond the numbers and strive to understand the business, deliver actionable insights, key findings, and conclusions that will help steer the business toward success. You will regularly analyze the business's actual performance on a monthly/quarterly basis and compare it to the planned forecast performance, identifying any deviations and making recommendations as necessary. You'll be the trusted financial advisor for the organization, building strong relationships with stakeholders.
   

  

**The impact you will create:**
* Provide critical insights and recommendations to support data-driven decision-making
* Create and maintain financial models to evaluate various scenarios and strategies
* Ensure compliance with financial regulations and reporting standards
* Contribute to the overall financial strategy of the company


**What you bring in:**
* Bachelor's degree in business administration, finance, or equivalent
* 5+ years of experience as a Business Controller, or in similar analytical roles, ideally in fast-growing organizations
* A genuine interest in data analysis, based on curiosity regarding what lies behind the data
* Ambition to provide critical insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making
* Proficiency in data analysis, and preferably also forecasting and budgeting
* Good communication skills (Swedish and English) to collaborate with cross-functional teams
* An ability to see the larger picture while still ensuring that the details come out correctly


**It would be great if you also have:**
* Familiarity with Workday Adaptive or similar FP&A systems


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There's something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.

title: PLM Solution Architect
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your Role**
 We’re looking for Senior Solution Architects with experience from
 **Teamcenter, 3DExperience or Windchill** 
 , who can bring value to the team and work as a key resource in our PLM projects. You will act as a creator of architectural design, defining system requirements and use cases to address overall business requirements, ensuring that the technical solution remains aligned and delivers value throughout any project.
   

  

* Lead customer project delivery activities and conduct requirements gathering workshops
* Design and communicate high/low-level architecture for PLM and associated systems
* Collaborate with Capgemini teams, software vendors, and customers to propose solutions
* Guide onsite/offshore teams and ensure deliverables meet expectations
* Support pre-sales activities including demos and budgetary proposals


**Your Profile**
* University degree, preferably in Computer Science or Engineering
* Expertise in Teamcenter, 3DExperience or Windchill implementations
* 4+ years of experience working in a Nordic country
* Excellent communication skills in English, both oral and written
* Swedish work permit or Swedish citizenship


 It is considered an advantage if you have proficiency in Swedish, both spoken and written. Experience with coding languages and tools such as Java, JSP, MQL, EKL, and Widgets is highly valued. Familiarity with data migration processes, CAD tools, and integrations between PLM, CAD, and ERP systems will strengthen your profile. Additionally, having worked in multi-cultural and distributed project teams is beneficial.
   

  

**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Technical Advisor / Senior Consultant
description:
**Job Description**
**Technical Advisor / Senior Consultant**
 We invite you to bring your project management and engineering background into play as you contribute to the energy transition towards renewable energy sources and sustainability. To succeed in this role, you must have experience and understanding of early-phase projects and a passion for the green energy transition. Are you our new Technical Advisor/Senior Consultant? Click the apply button to send your application.
   

  

**Inviting bright minds**
 Do you want to push the boundaries of your profession and develop your excellence in an open, collaborative, and empowering culture? We work to create a sustainable future, and our inspiring projects and innovative solutions aim to set the standard among our peers. You will join a global company that has been growing successfully since its founding in 1945. Together, we lead and leave a positive impact on societies, companies, and people around the world.
   

  

 Are you passionate about shaping the future of energy and industry? We are looking for an experienced and driven
 **Technical Advisor / Senior Consultant** 
 to join our growing advisory team, driving the development of early-phase studies, technical and strategic assessments within the green energy transition. We focus on decarbonisation of heavy industries, carbon capture, utilisation & storage (CCUS), hydrogen and Power-to-X, energy storage, and gas infrastructure.
   

  

**Your new role**
 As the
 **Technical Advisor / Senior Consultant** 
 , you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and driving a diverse portfolio of early-phase studies and initiatives. Your strategic vision and project management expertise will be instrumental in ensuring the successful execution of these studies and in building strong client relationships.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will be:
   

  

  

* Lead and deliver pre-feasibility, feasibility, and conceptual design studies, technology and strategic assessments for clients across the energy and industrial sectors.
* Manage projects, ensuring high-quality outcomes, client satisfaction, and timely delivery in line with the agreed budget.
* Actively contribute to business development, including proposal preparation, client engagement, and identifying new market opportunities.
